alert.note: Alert for Vernon (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 20 at 7:53PM CDT until March 25 at 10:36AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Missouri... Little Osage River near Horton affecting Vernon County. For the Little Osage River Basin...including Horton...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING TO LATE FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Little Osage River near Horton. * WHEN...From Wednesday morning to late Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 41.0 feet, minor flooding affects low lying areas near the gage site and farmland along the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 29.9 feet. Based on precipitation forecasts, the river could approach of exceed flood stage later in the week. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 41.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 400 AM CDT.
